column4: i have a xp system that i put ubuntu on, it just boots to windows, should i try to fix, or reinstall?
what did you use to install ubuntu? the cd? or is it a virtual ubuntu?
cd
so when you run the computer, does it go into the boot menu with windows and ubuntu on it?
no boot menu
when you ran the live cd did you actually click the "intall" icon?
i have done dual boot innstall before, this is the first time with 9.10
i have done dual boot innstall before, this is the first time with 9.10 , made custom partitions
is there any way that you can re run the cd and re install the system?
yes, its probably easier than fixing it huh
and did you decide to install ubuntu boot on MBR or the custom partition you made
custom partition
partition = root 10 gb, 2gb swap, 20 gb home
that's the problem, because your custom partition has no way into getting in the MBR list. i recommend that you install ubuntu booting into the MBR. It's the easiest
how exactly ? use "side by side" option?
very likely, I think that ubuntu chooses to put the boot file on the MBR byb default, so you wouldn't need to do anything special
THIS SUCKS i cant do it, it wants to wipe out windows, or my data drive
that is one reason i went custom before
it puts my data drive as sda, which is wrong
IF i have to unplug my data drive that is very unfriendly
anyone, do i pick use the largest contigous free space? and if so will windows be ok or not?
ok thx
you still here?
